data.oai_dc:dc: Data obtained from a common garden temperature gradient experiment with two subpopulations of anadromous pike (Esox lucius) from the Baltic Sea. In the experiment, eggs were artificially fertilized, and a split-brood design with three different temperature treatments was used to test for effects of temperature during early fry development. Four offspring performance measures (hatching success, fry survival during the first 5 days, day degrees until hatching, and fry body length 5 days post hatch) were quantified. Data on hatching success and fry survival is presented in ‘performance.xlsx’, data on day degrees until hatching in ‘daydegrees.xlsx’, and data on fry body length in ‘lengths.xlsx’.
